page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY_TREMATON CSTL.
page.content: THE CORNISH NAME CAME FROM{TRE}MEANING HOMESTEAD AND{MATERN}THE{KING.TREMATON {CASTLE}IS BUILT ON THE SUMMIT OF A HILL ABOUT 60M ABOVE FORDER CREEK.IT IS BUILT ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE RIVER LYNHER AND IT LOOKS OUT TO PLYMOUTH. TREMATON,WHICH WAS BUILT IN THE YEAR 1080,IS A "MOTTE AND BAILEY" CASTLE. THE GATE HOUSE WAS BUILT IN THE 13TH CENTURY.THE KEEP IS NOT ROUND,IT IS OVAL.THE HEIGHT OF THE KEEP IS 10M AND THE WALLS ARE 3M THICK AT THE BOTTOM. THE GATE HOUSE IS THE ONLY ENTRANCE, EXCEPT FOR THE SALLY PORT WHICH WAS USED FOR A QUICK ESCAPE. TWO IMPORTANT PEOPLE THAT WE KNOW STAYED IN THE CASTLE WERE PRINCE EDWARD THE BLACK PRINCE AND SIR FRANCIS DRAKE. THERE IS AN ENTRY FOR TREMATON CASTLE IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK.
